task.title: Creating a Community Group
task.abstract: Create a new Community Group that can be made available for Community Portal users.For private groups, group members can only be created and modified by the Group Owner or the Group Manager.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Community Groups tab in the Communities app and click New.
Enter the Community Group Name and use the picklist to select the Member Entity Type. Every Community Group must have a unique Name, even when using multiple Sites.
step.info:
The Member Entity Type defines the type of group members allowed in a group:
Contacts
Accounts
Groups A group cannot contain more than one Member Entity Type. If the Member Entity Type is set to Contact, the system will create a Community Group member for the related contact when the selected user has the Community Portal User profile. The default is set to Contact. Best practices recommend entering the Email associated with the Group and the Group Type.

step.cmd: Enter the Group Image URL, Banner, and the Description.

substep.cmd: Group Image URL - Displays on the Groups Search page and the Group Detail page in the Community Portal. The Group Owner can change the Group's profile image from within the Community Portal by hovering over the image and clicking on the Change Photo button.
Banner - Displays on the Group Detail page in the Community Portal. The Group Owner can change the Banner image from within the Community Portal by clicking the Change Background button.

Description - Displays within the Banner image on the Group Detail page. If the created text is too long to fully appear in the provided area, users can click the More Detail button to view a pop up window.

step.cmd: Link the Community Group to the Site via the lookup.
Select Customer Portal User from the Group Owner picklist. In the adjacent picklist field, assign the Community Group Owner a User profile.
step.info: The Group Owner serves as the Group Administrator. In order for the Group Owner to be included as a Community Group member, assign the Community Portal User profile to the Group Owner prior to enabling the Is Published field.
Selecting the Customer Portal User as the Group Owner allows for the User to modify Group details, such as description, images, and tabs, directly from the Group Detail page in the Community Portal.

stepsection.b: Configure Feature Support and Privacy Settings

step.cmd: Determine the visibility of Community Group record elements and the process to join a group for Community Portal users via Privacy Settings:

ul.li: Public- Defines a group that allows portal users to freely join without approval by clicking the Join button. If enabled by the Group Owner, users that are not members of the group can view the group's Community Feed, Members, and Events.

Private- Defines a join process where the member requesting to join must be approved by a Group Manager. Whereas the Members and Events tabs are visible to non-members, if enabled by the Administrator, the Community Feed tab is only available for members.

Unlisted- Defines a group where a non-member cannot join because the group is not visible to anyone outside the group. Only the Group Owner can assign a portal user to an Unlisted Group. Unlisted Groups will not appear in any search results or lists and can only be seen by members.

step.info: The default Privacy Setting is set to Public.

ul.li: Enabling the Private Members, Private Community Feed, and Private Events checkboxes will hide the tabs from non-members of Public Groups, overriding the Privacy Setting.
Checking the Disable Join checkbox will hide the Join button on the Banner image for Groups in the Community Portal.

step.cmd: Check the Is Published checkbox and click Save.

taskbody.result: A new Community Group is created and displayed in the Groups Search page of the Community Portal.
